reg.title: West Nile Virus Control Regulation
reg.amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 4/2010, January 14, 2010]

definition.def: means an order made under section 3 to apply pesticides;

paragraph.paragraphtext: a licence issued under section 4 of the Integrated Pest Management Act,
a permit issued under section 6 of the Integrated Pest Management Act,
a pest management plan and a pesticide use notice prepared, and a confirmation received, under section 7 of the Integrated Pest Management Act, or
any other record under the Integrated Pest Management Act

section.defsandwich: that authorizes the minister to use pesticide products for the purpose of controlling mosquito species in areas of British Columbia where there is a risk to human health from West Nile Virus.

section.marginalnote: West Nile virus prescribed as health hazard
section.sectiontext: The following are prescribed as health hazards for the purpose of this regulation:

paragraph.paragraphtext: any agent or condition that transmits, or contributes to the transmission of, the West Nile virus.

subsection.subsectiontext: The provincial health officer or a medical health officer may order a local government to apply pesticides to any area within the jurisdiction of the local government if satisfied that the application of pesticides is necessary to protect the public health through the prevention or removal of a health hazard prescribed in section 2.
A person issuing a pesticide application order must

paragraph.paragraphtext: serve the order on the local government,
state in the order the time by which the local government must comply with the order,
set out in the order any conditions of a pesticide use authority that the person requires the local government to comply with, and
provide the local government a copy of a pesticide use authority.

subsection.subsectiontext: A person issuing a pesticide application order may authorize, in the order, the application of pesticides to private property, with or without the consent of the owner or occupant of the property.
A local government that is served with a pesticide application order must

paragraph.paragraphtext: comply with the order on or before the date set out in the order,
comply with any conditions set out under section 3 (2) (c), and
provide to the person who issued the order any information or assistance required by that person to comply with any other conditions of the pesticide use authority.
